pros: Clinical staff, both clinicians and supervisors, are paid very well and able to earn incentives and a yearly bonus. Coworkers are great.
cons: When it rains, it pours. Staff are asked to do more and more while being told that “it will get better.” Oftentimes as a supervisor, it seems that our role is to be a clinician first and provide support to staff next. There is very little time to work on building quality programs or for care management.

pros: Learned a lot of valuable information
cons: Extremely clicky environment. Felt left out

pros: Love my coworkers, love my clients, great time off
cons: Upper management DOES NOT care about the well being, mental health etc of staff. All they care about is money, getting as many billable hours as physically possible out of the you as they can. Upper management is extremely detached from reality. Turn over rate is unbelievable. They pretend to care but actually just gaslight you into thinking you’re crazy for asking for basic human decency, like a break to use the bathroom. Health insurance is also trash.

pros: Flexible hours, independent work setting
cons: High demands, high staff turnover

pros: I enjoyed the experience working closely with probation and the courts.
cons: The pay was NOT a live-able wage.

review_title: A good company if you are placed in the right spot.

pros: Good Co-Workers, Sufficient Time-Off, Location

review_title: Dont work here if you value your sanity
job_title: Integrated healthcare clinician in Hartford, CT

review_title: Great entry level position if your wanting to gain experience
pros: Trainings and overall the knowledge you gain. You also get to build relationships with CSSD if you have plans of trying to become a probation officer
cons: pay and no ability to do overtime.

pros: good benefits, supervision, experience with wide age range, able to collaborate with medical staff such as nurses
cons: not a lot of time for case management/paperwork, high productivity requirements

job_title: Senior Direct Care Counselor/S-Fit Program in Plainville, CT
pros: Youth, Weekly pay, met a couple of incredible co workers
cons: Pay rate, no holiday pay, management gossip, lack compassion , empathy and etc.

pros: PTO is nice, so are coworkers
cons: management is lacking in all aspects

pros: Getting other jobs is easier when you have this on your resume, because other employers know you’ve been through it.
cons: Truly underpaid for the work that’s done. Literally any other non-profit in the area will pay more for the same job. No work to life balance because supervisors actively try to make sure you’re always working. You’re paid salary for 40 hours a week but are expected to be working 60+. You’re forced to be on call for at least one solid week a month, which means if there’s any problems, upper management will force you to leave your home (no matter what time it is) to go and assess the child, even if the family’s decline wanting you there. You do not get paid a dime more for doing so. You accrue PTO at a pretty good rate, but are actively discouraged by management to take said time. If you do end up being able to get time off approved, you’re sent multiple emails reminding you you need to make up the productivity you weren’t able to get due to being off as soon as you get back. Burn out in this job is REAL and upper management refuses to listen to staff ideas of how to prevent it. I’d rather be unemployed than put myself through working here again. My mental health has never deteriorated so fast.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Waterbury, CT
pros: Flexible if you are not slammed
cons: Not respected. Management changes policies and lacks consistent follow through.

job_title: Special Education Paraprofessional in Plainville, CT
pros: Supportive classroom coworkers, flexible hours, yearly bonus, making a difference, regular feedback on performance
cons: Expensive benefits, poor pay, no room for growth

job_title: Staff Development Manager in Bristol, CT
pros: I have been at Wheeler Clinic for 24 years. I have found job satisfaction and pride in being part of a company which helps over 30,000 people who come through our doors each year. There is a sincere desire to always improve our performance and to provide the best quality services for each child and adult who needs them.
cons: The only con's I can add are that we are a non-profit organization. This is not the place to look if you want the top salary in a business setting. It is the place to work if you want great experience and the opportunity to truly make a difference.

review_title: No Training, Poor Management, Poor work environment
pros: Nice/supportive co-workers who all helped to train each other due to lack of any formal training
cons: I was provided with absolutely no training for my job, and this seemed common for many new staff. The work environment was terrible and I was told to "live with it". I was told that I was not required to bring work home, but was called out at a meeting for not being a "team player" for not bringing work home. Management is focused on tasks and managers micromanage everyone, no matter what their position is. The job description did not match what the actual job was at all. There is a very high turnover rate in the company, which means everyone is new and trying to train each other. Lunch was "frowned upon".

job_title: Administration and Support in Plainville, CT
pros:
Being part of a team of people dedicated to improving the lives of clients, students and the communities we live in.
Good health and retirement benefits.
cons:
Very lean, and resource constrained organization.  
Gov't program funding makes it very difficult to be equitable and consistent.   
Difficult work, staffing and retention risks, potential burn out.

job_title: Outpatient Clinician in New Britain, CT
pros:
-Enjoyed getting to know fellow clinicians and staff 
-Good, well-rounded experience gained
cons:
-Too much expected of clinicians in too little time. Overloaded with paperwork, and no time to complete it. It becomes like a client factory, people in and out, with no time to prepare anything and give them what they need. 

They expect you to take home a lot of work, with no overtime pay.

review_title: Good for Fee-for-Service (FFS) Clinicians, but not Full-Time Clinicians
pros: The FFS pay was good and there were less requirements than full time staff. Nice not to have to find your own clients and you are able to make your own schedule as a FFS staff.
cons: Very demanding, constantly changing requirements, constantly changing staff and management, not a lot of thought put into client care from management, and supervisors are not trained to be supervisors. As a FFS Clinician, this can feel especially unsupportive and isolating.

review_title: My experience at Wheeler since I was hired three years ago has been good
pros: Good salary. Friendly staff (can't speak for Wheeler in general but my specific program and the people I interact with are friendly and helpful)
cons: Management not always on same page making it difficult for employees to know how to do something the right way

pros: Motivated staff who cared about clients.  Ample chances for in-service training.  Organization was very professional.  Senior clinical staff had well considered vision for agency.
cons: Supervision was not very direct.  Workload could make job very pressured.  Little empathy for problems with workload.

pros: Decent salary and benefits offered, great time off and sick time.
cons: Management does not follow work protocols and procedures. Upper management doesn't care about the employees. Managers will retaliate against employees and the employee has little support because they are all friends with HR. Management talks about employees to other management and fellow employees. lack all professional standards and they get away with it because if you complain or go to HR they will paint YOU as the problem.

pros: Great experience especially for entry-level clinicians.
cons: Management doesn't seem to care if employees are overworked, and are not very supportive. Not much room for advancement in the company. Focus seems to be more on building their empire than client needs.

job_title: Family Support Specialist in Hartford, CT
pros: Worked with a wonderful team of colleagues that were dedicated to meeting the needs of the clients
cons: Requires a lot of clinical documentation, which can be overwhelming.

pros: Large organization with a vision and possibilities to grow professionally.  I loved working there and recommend very highly to anyone considering to apply
cons: No complains whatsoever about this agency. Locations all over CT makes it accessible and it provides a diverse population to work with

pros: Flexible schedule. Supportive co workers and supervisor.

pros: My managers are excellent and respectful. They work collaboratively and our department strives for process improvement and fairness.
cons: Nothing bad to say. I love working here.

pros: There were regular pay increases.
cons: Unrealistic expectations of staff and management - overburdened and burned out staff. Does not provide good clinical care (there would be clients who haven’t seen a clinician in weeks). This agency cares more about the bottom line than providing quality clinical care.
